description.narrative: Support to the Somali Police Force through institutional development, strengthening leadership and improving community engagement to ensure service delivery in the Federal Member States

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative: - Political agreement on NPM approved in June 2016 - 3 Somalia police mobile training teams established in 2017 for middle management training. Middle management training modules developed. - 4 community committees at 4 police stations in 4 regions of Puntland established in 2017. No assessment. - 3 quarterly reports and one annual report developed

Target 1. 2 (two) policies (defining functions, structure, and process for both federal and FMS based on NPM) Target 2. 2 (two) consultation meetings for the legal framework Target 3. 5 (five) police station management trainings undertaken for FMS police Target 4. Middle management training modules revised. Target 5. Media messaging system established by SPF (to be shared with Sate Polcie services for potential use) Target 6. Police – community forums in 21 districts (17 Banadir, one Baidoa, one Kismayo, one Addado and one Jowhar) Target 7. Community Policing Consultations in Jubaland, South-West State, Galmudug, Benadir Region, Hirshabelle and Puntland Target 8. Provide security and office equipment to MoIS and SPF to improve operation performance Target 9. 392 youth volunteers continuously receiving incentive Target 10. 392 youth trained Target 11. Monthly monitoring and evaluation missions and progress reports generated.

Result 1. 2 (two) policy documents developed in Somali language: (1) The Somali Police Act and (2) The Somali Police Regulations. Result 2. 2 (two) consultation meetings regarding the Police Act and Police Regulations conducted. Result 3. 9 police station management trainings targeting 385 police officers (M:355; F: 30) from Jubaland, South-West State, Galmudug, Hirshabelle and Puntland. Result 4. 2 evaluation workshops conducted in Mogadishu and Garowe. SPF Planning and Training Directorate will review and revise recommendations and circulate to FMS for inputs before finalizing revised middle management training modules. Result 5. SPF Media and Public Relations officer appointed in October 2018 and social media accounts established. However, this person was killed in a car explosion in December 2018, which halted progress. However, SPF senior police officers are now appreciating the value of using social media to communicate with the public and continue to use social media for public communication and relation building. Result 6. Community-policing committees established across 21 districts Result 7. 12 Community Policing Consultations to introduce and discuss the community-policing model and its implementation in Jubaland, South-West State, Galmudug, Benadir Region, Hirshabelle and Puntland targeting 1,022 (M:616; F:406) police officers and community members Result 8. Security and office equipment purchased and delivered to MoIS and SPF Result 9. 392 youth volunteers continuously receiving incentive Result 10. 392 youth volunteers capacitated on community policing through training and education at 2 locations for 5 days Result 11. 10 monthly monitoring and evaluations missions conducted. 3 progress reports generated
